Last night I'd made the decision to assist Shion in\nhelping Kamimori City.%K%P
We had agreed to discuss specifics later and had\nleft it at that.%K%P
\d--ki... Aki...\d%K%P
I heard a familiar voice, along with something\nbrushing my cheeks.%K%P
\dCome on, Aki. Wake up!\d%K%P

The sight of Shion instantly snapped me out of\nmy slumber.%K%P

\dMorning... Oh, shoot!\d%K%P

\dYeah, it's only around four in the morning.\d%K%P
\dWhat...?!\d%K%P
I checked my phone and saw I still had an hour\nuntil my usual wake-up time.%K%P
\dIt offends me how you think you overslept\njust because I'm up.\d%K%P
\dCome on. Put yourself in my shoes for a moment.\d%K%P

\dNope. I'm just psyched about last night.\nI couldn't sleep!\d%K%P

The way Shion always took immediate action was a\nvirtue of hers, but I never thought I'd be woken\nup this early.%K%P

Seeing Shion so fired up blew away my drowsiness,\neven at this hour.%K%P

I knew that was coming.%K%P
Shion wasn't the type to think things through.%K%P

Sure enough, they weren't as big as Yukari's or\nKaede's, but they were still perfectly nice.\nI couldn't take my eyes off them.%K%P

The three of us entered the shrine and sat down.%K%P
\dSo, what is this about?\d%K%P
\dWe need to have a discussion.\d%K%P
\dWhat a rare occasion. I'm all ears.\d%K%P

Shion was just as nervous talking to Kaede about\nher dreams as she had been with me.%K%P

\dI see. I get what you're trying to say.\d%K%P

\dI can't approve it, though.\d%K%P
Kaede immediately rejected Shion's request.%K%P
\dWhat!? Come on, Kaede. Give it some more\nthought!\d%K%P

Shion fought back, but Kaede just shook her head.\nShe wasn't going to change her mind.%K%P
\dFor me to even consider it you must give me a\nspecific idea, along with its budget and timeline.\d%K%P
\dWanting to do 'something' just won't cut it.\d%K%P
Kaede turned her eyes to me.%K%P
I nodded back in agreement to her harsh words.%K%P
\dIt means she can only consider and approve\nconcrete proposals.\d%K%P
\dBut if I could get approval, I'd totally do\nsomething really big...\d%K%P
\dIf you want to do something big, it's even more\ncrucial to be organized from the start.\d%K%P
\dWhat are the safety procedures? The venue?\nAgenda on the event day? Everything must be\norganized beforehand.\d%K%P
\dIt's never easy to make things happen.\d%K%P
Shion fell silent, unable to object to Kaede's\njust reasoning.%K%P
\dI'm not rejecting it to bully you. It's wonderful\nthat you want to make things happen.\d%K%P
Noticing the silence, Kaede quickly softened her\nface and let out some words of encouragement.%K%P
\dTrust me Shion, I know you better than anyone.\nI've been by your side ever since you arrived\nin Kamimori.\d%K%P
\dAnd I'm really happy that you feel this way\nabout the town.\d%K%P

\dBut that's why I can't spoil you. As the shrine's\ndeity, I have to make careful considerations too.\d%K%P
I guess this was tough love.%K%P
Kaede was able to make profound judgments.%K%P
\dThink about it. Who is it you really want to\nmake happy?\d%K%P
\dWho I...really want to make happy...?\d%K%P
Shion looked down as she gave it thought.%K%P
This would be a crucial question for Shion every\nstep of the way.%K%P
\dYou know... The grandpas are always nice to me...\d%K%P
\dYes, I know.\d%K%P
\dInitially, I wanted to repay them for\ntheir kindness.\d%K%P
\dBut I felt like I needed to do something bigger,\nsomething town-wide!\d%K%P
\dI got lost in thought, but all I could come up\nwith were vague ideas.\d%K%P
\dYou're right. I shouldn't go about this with my\nfeelings all over the place.\d%K%P
\dOkay, the people I want to make happy first are\nthe old folks.\d%K%P
Shion looked up at Kaede as if a lightbulb had\ngone off in her head.%K%P
\dSomething come to you?\d%K%P
\dSure did. Thanks Kaede!\d%K%P
\dNow I've started listening to my heart, things\nare getting much clearer!\d%K%P
\dFollow that feeling. I look forward to hearing a\nproposal from you that I can get behind.\d%K%P
\dYup! Come on Aki, let's head back. It's time to\nstrategize some more!\d%K%P
\dHey, wait up, Shion!\d%K%P
\dAkira.\d%K%P
Right as I was about to head out of the shrine when\nKaede called my name.%K%P
\dI'm relying on you to watch her back.\d%K%P
\dYup, you can count on me.\d%K%P
\dAki! Hurry! Come on!\d%K%P
\dComing!\d%K%P
I gave a reassuring nod to Kaede and ran\nafter Shion.%K%P
After we returned home, we went to the kitchen\nto organize our thoughts.%K%P
\dSeemed like an idea struck you with Kaede's\nadvice. What was it?\d%K%P
\dIt's simple. I need to think about who I'm doing\nthis for.\d%K%P
\dTalking to Kaede, she helped me understand I was\ngetting ahead of myself, thinking how I want to\nmake everyone happy.\d%K%P
\dIt's not like that anymore?\d%K%P
\dOf course I still want to show my gratitude to\neveryone in Kamimori. But I figure I have to start\nwith the people closest to me.\d%K%P
\dPlus, I'd rather make people I know happy first\nbefore people I don't know so well.\d%K%P
\dThat's why I thought it'd be good to do something\nfor the seniors first.\d%K%P
\dThey all adore you, that's for sure.\d%K%P
\dExactly.\d%K%P
If Kaede was the town's idol, Shion's popularity\nequated to something like the town's cheerful\nmascot.%K%P
The elderly people she interacted with all treated\nher like a granddaughter. She had no problems\ngetting along with them.%K%P
\dThat said, I still don't know exactly what to\ndo about it.\d%K%P
\dThat's why I'm here to help. If we work together,\nwe'll come up with something good.\d%K%P
\dI'm counting on you, Aki!\d%K%P
\dBut, I wonder what'd make 'em happy?\d%K%P
\dAll my ideas so far aren't too exciting.\d%K%P
\dSo then... Ah.\d%K%P
I folded my arms to think, glanced at the fridge\nand remembered something.%K%P
\dShion, you do know that the local specialty here\nis the konnyaku, right?\d%K%P
\dYup. Everyone around town is excited about this\nyear's quality.\d%K%P
\dThat's right. But that konnyaku gets tougher to\neat as people get older.\d%K%P

\dIt's really chewy and hard to bite off. I hear\nolder folks complaining about not being able to\nenjoy it after making it themselves all the time.\d%K%P
\dSo why don't we come up with konnyaku dishes\nfor the elderly to enjoy?\d%K%P
\dKonnyaku dishes... Right, good idea.\d%K%P
\dIt must be tough not being able to eat\nwhat they love.\d%K%P
\dThey'd be ecstatic if they could eat it\nwithout worrying!\d%K%P
Shion was on board. The food suggestion had been\non the right track.%K%P
\dBut I'm usually the one eating the food, I don't\nhave a lot of confidence when it comes to cooking.\d%K%P
She'd said as much back at the time of\nthe festival.%K%P

\dI'll pass. I can't get dependent on her.\d%K%P
\dThese days, you can find everything online.\nI'm sure there are lots of recipes out there!\d%K%P

\dYup! Hehehe. Now begins my journey of cooking!\d%K%P

Shion left the kitchen and came back a few minutes\nlater with a bundle of paper.%K%P

It'd be tough to go through all those recipes.%K%P

\dYeah... This looks simple enough for me to\nprepare too!\d%K%P
\dCool. Let's try it out.\d%K%P
We started to prep for the first konnyaku recipe.%K%P
We'd been given some konnyaku as a gift, so we\nwere lucky enough to have all the ingredients on\nhand already.%K%P

\dThey should be in the lower cabinet.\d%K%P
\dOkay, thanks.\d%K%P
We gathered up the knife, cutting board, konnyaku,\nsesame oil, and white sesame seeds. Now to start\nwith the slicing.%K%P
\dWhoa. I didn't know konnyaku was this slimy\nwhen you take it out of the bag.\d%K%P

She was holding the handle with a clenched fist,\nholding down the konnyaku with her other hand, and\nwas trying to cut with the middle of the blade.%K%P

There was no way I was gonna let her cook\nwithout having the basics down.%K%P
Teaching her how to handle a kitchen knife and\ngiving tips on slicing was the least I could do. I\nstill felt uncomfortable about it, though.%K%P
\dSo, I hold the bottom of the blade with my thumb\nand index finger and use the rest of my hand to\nhold the handle...\d%K%P
It was a nerve-racking sight.%K%P
I just needed to make sure she didn't hurt herself.%K%P
\dI slice by pushing down, right?\d%K%P

She wasn't holding the konnyaku down firmly\nenough, and her other hand was trembling.%K%P
